revised_title: Understanding Dichromatism and Trichromatism in Color Vision
tldr: The author explains the nature of normal trichromatic and dichromatic vision, showing how dichromats see colors in relation to trichromats. They demonstrate that dichromatic isocolour lines either meet at a point representing a missing fundamental sensation or are parallel to a line joining the points representing the two fused sensations. The study concludes that the Young-Helmholtz theory of color vision is fundamentally correct.
